California joins Canada and the European Union in addressing the plastic pollution crisis. Our combined global market power ensures that real, impactful change will come. The global climate crisis requires considerable more action, but we’ve certainly taken a leap forward!

That’s not all. Industry will now be required to invest in our recycling infrastructure to prep for 📈 demand. They’ll also contribute $500m/year to restore impacted environments & address harms to disadvantaged communities.

Our state will now require producers to reduce single-use packaging production by 25% in the next decade. By then, single-use packaging still being produced will need to be *truly* recyclable or compostable. Only a small fraction of plastics are currently being ♻️ed.

Up until now, taxpayers have born the brunt of this crisis, through both rising waste collection rates and the $420 million our city/county governments spend annually to clean up plastic waste.

#SB54 rightfully transfers this responsibility to plastic producers.

Plastic pollution is exacerbating the climate crisis & impacting public health. Production is warming our planet while harming disadvantaged communities, land animals & sea life are choking on single-use packaging, and microplastics can be found in all of our bloodstreams.
